name: Valhalla Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well located b&b. Nice room, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: A must in Balloch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Graeme and Becky are very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Spotlessly clean room, warm service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is located in the middle of Balloch and is well within walking distance to the train station (next to it in fact), shopping centre, restaurants and lake.
reviews.title: Excellent!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was spotless, as was the attached bathroom. Two heaters in the room, plus one more in the bathroom. One plus for people who hate the usual 'flowery' B&B decor is that the room is decorated in a contemporary style, like a modern hotel.
reviews.title: First Class B&B!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was great, and the hosts were helpful, warm and friendly.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A small B&B with updated rooms. The B&B is very convenient located within steps of the train station and Sweeney Cruises. The hosts were welcoming. The breakfast was great. Do not hesitate to book this B&B.
reviews.title: All you could want...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay in this B&B. The owners made us feel very welcome and were very friendly. The rooms whilst not being too elegant and romantic were very clean, comfortable and pleasant. We would recommend this B&B and hope to visit it again one day. The location next to the railway station is good - we did not hear any trains at all and it was within walking distance to the castle and the lake is very close.
reviews.title: Friendly B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location and rooms... makes you feel at home with a wonderful breakfast :)
reviews.title: Excellent, friendly place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a charming little B&B right across from the train station (impossible to miss when arriving by train!), yet there was no appreciable train noise. The noise from the street did cause us to need to close our window at night, but other than that it was fine since the window was impressively soundproof.
reviews.title: Solidly delightful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was comfortable and clean, and there are many restaurants nearby as well as the Loch itself. Breakfast was wonderful, and Graeme and Becky are fantastic. They were even co-conspirators with my now-fiancé regarding proposal planning and ring procurement, and we got engaged on the shores of Loch Lomond. Beautiful memories.
reviews.title: Excellent B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Becky & Graeme are extremely friendly and helpful, nothing is too much trouble. Our bedroom & bathroom were very clean and well appointed, breakfast was excellent. A bonus was the secure parking available for bikes. We would certainly recommend Valhalla B & B.
reviews.title: An ideal place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Steve & Anita
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt us more than welcome - verry nice and friendly people. The bedroom as well as the bathroom were verry nice and clean.
reviews.title: we will definitely return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We can just recommend that B&B.
reviews.title: Hotel Standard Bed and Breakfast!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Graeme and Becky could not do enough to make our stay more welcoming
reviews.title: Hospitality at it's best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i felt like a little break and decided to go to Balloch. We stayed at Valhalla b&b and had a great time. It has a great location with easy access to Loch Lomond. The rooms are of hotel standard and whats more so is the service. We where made to feel at home by Becky and Graeme. It really is a little gem by the loch. We will definately return soon!!!!!!!
reviews.title: GIVES U EXACTLY WHAT IT SAYS ON THE DOOR (HEAVEN)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a few days at the end of October 2009. Excellent B & B with a great location for visiting Locjh Lomond and surrounding area. Easy access to Glasgow by train, the station platform is right outside the front door! Superb facilities at Valhalla and awesome breakfasts. Plenty of local good pubs and restaurants within a few minutes walk.
reviews.title: All round excellent B & B.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would not hesitate in booking Valhalla when we visit this area again.
reviews.title: Fantastic B & B in every way - don't miss the chance to go there!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We arrived in the town of Balloch and managed to get a room at the Valhalla and were so pleased that we did. Graeme and Becky could not have been more welcoming or helpful. Our room was a delight with Egyptian-style decor and the en-suite was spotless with even toiletries provided. We had a (free) colour t.v./dvd player in the room and Graeme offered a selection of movies to watch if we needed them. The tea-making facilities were great with endless supply of tea, coffee, etc. The cooked breakfast was fantastic and the best we have experienced in a long while. Becky and Graeme were informative about the area and suggested how best to get around whether you are walkers or have a car. I would not hesitate to recommend this lovely B & B, and would like to thank Becky and Graeme for their warm hospitality. Nova & Allan (North Wales)
reviews.title: Bikers welcome !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was a very warm and friendly welcome. The room was clean and comfortable, as well the bathroom. The scottish breakfast was excellent and the hosts are very sympathetic.
reviews.title: À very neat Place

description: Valhalla Bed & Breakfast provides quality accommodation right in the very heart of Balloch. Directly next to the railway station, and only a few hundred meters from the picturesque riverside, we have en-suite rooms which can cater for single travellers, or parties of up to seven people. Valhalla's fresh decor, legendary breakfasts, and free wi-fi, mean there is no better choice when staying in the Loch Lomond area.
